results.title: Rue des Prairies = Meadows Street
results.creator_credit: Denys de la Patelliere and Alexandre Mnouchkine
results.brief_description:
At the end of World War II, Henri, returns from a POW camp to his three children. Life as a widowed father proves very challenging for Henri as the children seem to either get into trouble or turn against their father.

Credits: Producer, Alexandre Mnouchkine ; director, Denys de la Patelliere ; writer, Michel Audiard ; photography, Louis Page ; music, Georges van Parys.
Cast: Marie-Jose Nat, Jean Gabin, France Asselin, Roger Dumas, Claude Brasseur, Leon Zitrone.

results.title: Rude Journee Pour la Reine = Rough Day for the Queen
results.brief_description:
A day in the life of an ordinary family: Jeanne works as a cleaning lady, Albert is a night watchman. Julien, their son is arrested. At his release, his attempts to establish contact with his girlfriend Annie are thwarted by her parents who oppose the relationship. Departing from her usual role of victim and servant, Jeanne decides to plot to reunite the two lovers. To achieve this, she resorts to a secret weapon: her vivid imagination and her Walter Mitty-like fantasies of being a queen.

Credits: Producer, Yves Gasser ; director, Rene Allio ; writers, Gerard Chartreux, Janine Peyre ; photography, Denys Clerval ; music, Philippe Arthuys.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Jacques Debary, Olivier Perrier, Orane Demazis, Christiane Rorato, Gerard Depardieu.

results.title: Rude
results.creator_credit: Clement Virgo, Colin Brunton, Damon D'Oliveira, Karen King, Conquering Lion Production and Feature Film Project
results.brief_description: This urban drama, the first feature length Canadian film to be made by an all black crew, is set amid a group of disenchanted black teenagers living in the ‘projects’ (public housing) who seek to express themselves, as they struggle against the confines of their lower class economic constraints that exclude them from mainstream society. Rude is an underground female pirate DJ who, seeking a voice for the troubles that seethe around her, transmits to the projects; General arrives home from jail spell for drug dealing to reconcile with his wife, Jessica (a police officer) and son; General’s brother longs for Jessica, and works for a white racist drug lord; Jordan, a young boxer, participates in gay bashing, despite his burgeoning desire for men; disconsolate Maxine reflects upon a failed relationship. The fortunes of these characters represent the disempowerment of Canadian minority groups, whose failure to have their cultural origins acknowledged within the broader milieu of the community is echoed in numerous misguided and frustrated acts of aggression. The explicit, rhythmic, political, and erotic rapping of Rude mirrors a potent narrative, moving and frightening in its intensity as it explores the themes of social isolation, homophobia, abortion, drug abuse and the violent expressions of youth.

results.title: Rubbish. A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: Michael Balson, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia
results.brief_description: Rubbish; A non-narrated fantasy adventure about the world of puppets created by a young boy from the odds and ends he collects in the streets. The adventure begins in the long alleys and narrow laneways of the city and culminates in a secret magic place known only to the young boy and his friend the kettlebird. Starring Emil Minty. “A Puppet pudding”; An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presented by Richard Bradshaw.

results.title: Rubbery figures: the world's greatest treasurer
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson, Peter Nicholson, Cynthia Mann and Rubbery Figures Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of rubbery figures skits that first featured regularly in the Australian television comic series of the late 1980’s “Fast forward”. An irreverent and satirical play on the then Australian Prime Minister and treasurer (and comic duo it seems), Bob Hawke and Paul Keating. Includes skits Evil Kneating, Back to the Future and more. Puppeteers: Esther Haskell, Jenny Ishmakovich, Jenny Sherlock and Kath Gordon.

results.title: Royal Wedding
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire delivers a magnificent series of dancing performances in this outstanding musical which also stars Jane Powell, Sarah Churchill, Peter Lawford and Keenan Wynn. Fred Astaire plays the role of a journalist sent to cover the Royal Wedding in London. This is the film which used the revolutionary photographic techniques which allowed Fred Astaire to do his famous “dancing on the ceiling”. Rated: G

results.title: Royal visit to Melbourne 1963 [Work print]
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Work print footage of the royal visit in 1963. Includes aerial views of Melbourne, the arrival of the royal yacht, The Queen and Price Phillip being greeted by dignitaries, the inspection of troops, passing crowds in a Rolls Royce, the arrival at a racetrack and a reception at the Melbourne Town Hall

results.title: Royal visit to Melbourne 1963
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Colour film record of the visit to Melbourne of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh. The three crowded, exciting days are show in detail. Includes the arrival of Her Majesty, presentation of the cup at the races at Flemington, a glittering State reception, service at Scot’s Church, Myer Music Bowl concert, Moomba parade, waving to country children en route to open the Royal Children’s Hospital, investiture at Government House, and farewell at the wharf.

results.title: Royal river [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Gordon Sparling, Grant McLean and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The picturesque St. Lawrence, Canada’s river of history, welcomes Queen Elizabeth II to the opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway. Many close-ups of the Queen, Prince Philip and President Eisenhower are shown. The theme of the film is the river’s history, from its discovery by French explorers to its opening to the shipping of the world. This is an abridged version.
